content: Those risks include, but are not limited to, risks associated with pricing, volume, inventory supply due to increased customer demand and reduced manufacturing production levels due to component shortages, conditions of markets and adverse developments in the economy as well as the public health crisis related to the COVID-19 virus and resulting impacts on demand for new and used vehicles and related services. But given the volume levels, maybe specifically talking about the U.S. that we've seen in aggregate for the industry for calendar year 2021 and what seems like it's going to transpire in '22. We've hired 16% of our -- we've increased our base 16% in the last year, but we want to continue to hire like there's more growth opportunity there. And clearly, the power of F&I is an incremental volume, right, maybe get $200 less a unit, but if you're getting more turns from selling more new and used cars, well, that's a powerful offset.
